bibl.title: Letter from Howard A. Kelly to A.S. von Mansfelde, [1906]

div1.p: Kelly will help Carroll, but not to the detriment of Reed. Kelly asks von Mansfelde to send him any worthy names for a Cyclopedia of American Medical Biography that he is compiling.

div1.head: Letter from Howard A. Kelly to A.S. von Mansfelde, [1906]
div1.p:
I will do all I can and
write as you suggest. I have already preached Carroll's
work on many occasions, in season and out. You will do
Carroll more good by insisting on his own superior merits
than by any detraction of Reed's work. You cannot push
Carroll's claims through with injury to Reed. I speak
with the absolute conviction of the knowledge of the
sentiments of the best men in the medical profession in
this country. You will only ruin Carroll and do
Reed no good by any course other than one of
the utmost kindliness and courtesy. I say
this because both your letters contain hints at
more strenuous measures in case you should find them
necessary. I tell you with absolute certainty that your
strenuous measures will not work, but decent measures will
bring Carroll all the credit he is entitled to without hurt-
ing Reed in the least.

I am writing a Cyclopedia of American Medical
Biography, and if you know of any eminent men (deceased)
in your part of the country, who ought to be included,
I wish you would send me their names and biographical
data. You see you have been writing setting me some work
to do, so I am giving you some in return.

Please stirs around and help me in this matter,
it is an important one. The Cyclopedia will run into
several volumes, possibly five.
